headline: Price Target on CrowdStrike (CRWD) Raised by Japanese Bank After Layoffs
summary: Japanese bank Mizuho Securities increased its price target on IT security giant CrowdStrike (CRWD) to $425 from $410 today. Mizuho remains upbeat on the company’s leadership team after it announced that it would lay off about 5% of its workforce. CRWD also reported that its first-quarter financial results would meet or exceed its previous guidance. […]

headline: CrowdStrike Stock Slides as Cybersecurity Firm Plans Job Cuts
summary: Crowdstrike shares slid Wednesday, a day after the cybersecurity company said in a regulatory filing it plans to cut roughly 500 jobs, or 5% of its workforce.

raw.headline: CrowdStrike Stock Slides as Cybersecurity Firm Plans Job Cuts

headline: Why CrowdStrike (CRWD) Shares Are Plunging Today
summary: Shares of cybersecurity company CrowdStrike (NASDAQ:CRWD) fell 5.1% in the morning session after the company announced a 5% cut to its workforce as part of efforts to stay more efficient using AI, though it planned to continue filling strategic roles in the current year. As part of the plan, the company expects to incur restructuring expenses, which could negatively affect its earnings in the year, and it is not clear if it will immediately offset the costs using its new efficiency plans.

As part of the plan, the company expects to incur restructuring expenses, which could negatively affect its earnings in the year, and it is not clear if it will immediately offset the costs using its new efficiency plans.

headline: Marvell postpones investor day, CrowdStrike layoffs, Tesla sales
summary: Marvell Technology (MRVL) postpones its investor day until 2026. Cantor Fitzgerald analysts downgrade the stock to neutral. CrowdStrike (CRWD) is laying off 5% of its workforce as the cybersecurity company reaffirms its guidance for fiscal 2026. Tesla's (TSLA) China sales fall as Chinese EV competitors see gains. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Catalysts here.

headline: CrowdStrike to Cut 5% of Workforce
summary: CrowdStrike said it will cut about 500 jobs, or 5% of its global workforce, as part of a plan to drive efficiencies in the business.

headline: CrowdStrike to lay off 5% of staff, reaffirms forecasts
summary: Austin, Texas-based CrowdStrike said the rest of the charges will be seen in the second quarter.  CrowdStrike had 10,118 full-time employees as of January 31, according to its annual report.  "While we will continue to prudently hire, primarily in customer-facing and product engineering roles, we are reducing roles in some areas of the business," CEO George Kurtz said in a note to the company's employees.

"While we will continue to prudently hire, primarily in customer-facing and product engineering roles, we are reducing roles in some areas of the business," CEO George Kurtz said in a note to the company's employees.

headline: 3 Reasons CRWD Has Explosive Upside Potential
summary: CrowdStrike currently trades at $445.65 and has been a dream stock for shareholders. It’s returned 490% since May 2020, blowing past the S&P 500’s 94.2% gain. The company has also beaten the index over the past six months as its stock price is up 34.7% thanks to its solid quarterly results.
